title: Mother Outraged After Daycare Worker Breastfeeds Her Son Without Permission!
text:
2/07/2017 6:33 PM ET | Filed under: Icky Icky Poo • Baby Blabber • Legal Matters • Perezcious Parenting • Boobs • Viral: Kids • Viral: News 
Got someone else's milk? 
A North Carolina mother wants to press charges against a daycare worker she alleges was caught breastfeeding her child without her permission! 
On Friday, Kaycee Oxendine recorded video from the security footage inside Carrboro Early School that shows a woman nursing Oxendine's 3-month-old son from her bosom. 
Related: Olivia Wilde Calls ‘Bullshit' On Breast Pump Ad! 
The outraged mother, who works at the daycare as a pre-kindergarten teacher, said it all started when her son's teacher told her he was constipated. 
Another woman working in the nursery that day then asked Oxendine if she could breastfeed the boy to see if it would help with his constipation — she said no. Twice. 
Oxendine recounted denying the "nasty" offer, telling ABC-11 : 
"She said that she had a son and did I want her to put my child to her breast and breastfeed? And I said no, that's nasty. We don't do things like that." 
Oxendine said just moments after she left the room, the security footage showed the daycare worker picking up the baby and breastfeeding him for several seconds until another worker in the room stood up to leave. 
Related: Britney Spears Asks For Prayers Following Niece's ATV Accident 
Daycare director Daron Council confirmed the lactating culprit is no longer working there. 
Even though the woman was fired on Friday, Oxendine wants her to face criminal charges, as her son is lactose intolerant and can't have any milk products. She explained: 
"To me, a criminal act was committed against him. Not only did you put your breast to my son, you also made my son sick because he's lactose intolerant. So you've put something in his body that his body can't digest." 
Local police said they were investigating the incident as misdemeanor child abuse. No charges have been filed just yet, but Oxendine hopes "there's justice for my son."
